repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

Fixes: #33458

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -215,7 +215,13 @@ local function get_locations(method, opts)
         vim.fn.settagstack(vim.fn.win_getid(win), { items = tagstack }, 't')
 
         vim.bo[b].buflisted = true
-        local w = opts.reuse_win and vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or win
+        local w = win
+        if opts.reuse_win then
+          w = vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or w
+          if w ~= win then
+            api.nvim_set_current_win(w)
+          end

comment_data.body:
`w ~= win and api.nvim_set_current_win(w)` would failed when compiling;

or `local _ = w ~= win and api.nvim_set_current_win(w)`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -215,7 +215,13 @@ local function get_locations(method, opts)
         vim.fn.settagstack(vim.fn.win_getid(win), { items = tagstack }, 't')
 
         vim.bo[b].buflisted = true
-        local w = opts.reuse_win and vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or win
+        local w = win
+        if opts.reuse_win then
+          w = vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or w
+          if w ~= win then
+            api.nvim_set_current_win(w)
+          end

@@ -215,7 +215,13 @@ local function get_locations(method, opts)
         vim.fn.settagstack(vim.fn.win_getid(win), { items = tagstack }, 't')
 
         vim.bo[b].buflisted = true
-        local w = opts.reuse_win and vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or win
+        local w = win
+        if opts.reuse_win then
+          w = vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or w
+          if w ~= win then
+            api.nvim_set_current_win(w)
+          end

comment_regular_data.body:
I can't determine which is better,
```lua
local w = opts.reuse_win and vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or win
if opts.reuse_win and w ~= win then
  api.nvim_set_current_win(w)
end
```
or 
```lua
local w = win
if opts.reuse_win then
  w = vim.fn.win_findbuf(b)[1] or w
  if w ~= win then
    api.nvim_set_current_win(w)
  end
end
```
A new test probably isn't needed, but just update the existing one?: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2f8fb4f28ab92d62e07d1d64a6dd89e0b6eb7253/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua#L3400

> A new test probably isn't needed, but just update the existing one?:
> 
> https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2f8fb4f28ab92d62e07d1d64a6dd89e0b6eb7253/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua#L3400

This unit test aims to test the function `vim.lsp.util.show_document` which impls differently underneath.
is there any way to make the test smaller? i was really hoping to avoid a gigantic, complicated test for this minor feature.

> is there any way to make the test smaller? i was really hoping to avoid a gigantic, complicated test for this minor feature. 

The change is in a local function which cannot be tested directly and it's only used in definition, implementation and declaration.
maybe I could try to find a better way to test it.

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua b/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua
index ebb8f20aaa..bbb5ffdbc8 100644
--- a/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua
@@ -5230,7 +5230,7 @@ describe('LSP', function()
   end)

   describe('lsp.buf.definition', function()
-    it('jumps to single location', function()
+    it('jumps to single location and can reuse_win', function()
       exec_lua(create_server_definition)
       local result = exec_lua(function()
         local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
@@ -5256,8 +5256,10 @@ describe('LSP', function()
         vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(win, { 3, 6 })
         local client_id = assert(vim.lsp.start({ name = 'dummy', cmd = server.cmd }))
         vim.lsp.buf.definition()
-        vim.lsp.stop_client(client_id)
         return {
+          win = win,
+          bufnr = bufnr,
+          client_id = client_id,
           cursor = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(win),
           messages = server.messages,
           tagstack = vim.fn.gettagstack(win),
@@ -5269,6 +5271,15 @@ describe('LSP', function()
       eq('x', result.tagstack.items[1].tagname)
       eq(3, result.tagstack.items[1].from[2])
       eq(7, result.tagstack.items[1].from[3])
+
+      n.feed(':vnew<CR>')
+      api.nvim_win_set_buf(0, result.bufnr)
+      api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, { 3, 6 })
+      n.feed(':=vim.lsp.buf.definition({reuse_win = true})<CR>')
+      eq(result.win, api.nvim_get_current_win())
+      exec_lua(function()
+        vim.lsp.stop_client(result.client_id)
+      end)
     end)
     it('merges results from multiple servers', function()
       exec_lua(create_server_definition)
```

title: fix(lsp): jump to the target win when opts.reuse_win is true
